New Records: England lost 10 wickets for 111 in 26.5 overs
England have been bowled out with – and you’ll love this – exactly 100 balls to spare
Key Match Events: England lost 10 wickets for 111 in 26.5 overs
Ben Stokes top-scored with a defiant, scruffy 43
Mark Wood was stumped for 5 runs
Adil Rashid was run out off a wide for 2 runs
Ben Stokes was caught for 43 runs
England’s World Cup defence is over before the halfway point
Pre-Game Insights: This pitch should suit England’s seamers, as it was offering some movement throughout their innings
The players are out there and Chris Woakes has the new ball
Post-Match Reflections: Buttler admits England hit ‘huge low’ in World Cup defeat by Sri Lanka
Matthew Mott, England’s Australian coach, finds himself losing to an English coach for the second time in this tournament
The player of the match is Lahiru Kumara, who took three for 35 and removed Jos Buttler, Liam Livingstone and Ben Stokes
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka win by eight wickets with almost half their overs to spare – 24.2 overs
This has been the shortest match in the 2023 World Cup
Sri Lanka go up to fifth in the table, ahead of Pakistan. Both those sides have four points from five games, as do Afghanistan.
England have two points from five – won one, lost four – and they are ninth.
Their net run rate is awful too (-1.63), but luckily for them the Netherlands’ is even worse (-1.90)
Others: England’s demise was shocking, though I’m not sure it was surprising. It fits the profile of their tournament - a great team who, in good faith, took on one job too many.
The two run-outs in particular were a window into England’s soul, and also their collective noggin.
